                    Text: 
                    New, Vintage, and Signed Blotter Art

Contribute $50 or more and get a piece of displayable blotter art. These look great framed on the wall !

Ketamine

Drug Testing

by Erowid

SUMMARY #

U.S. DRUG TESTING SUMMARY Ketamine Tested for in Standard Drug Tests ? NO Tested for in Extended Drug Tests ? YES (some areas) Possible to Test for? YES Detection Period in Urine 2-4 days

TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing


                    Context: 
                    This chunk introduces Erowid's ketamine drug testing overview, summarizing whether ketamine is detected in standard and extended drug tests in the U.S., its detectability, typical urine detection window, and basic test types, as part of a comprehensive section on drug testing information for ketamine within the Chemicals Vault.

metadata.title: Erowid Ketamine Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Ketamine and drug tests & urine screens.

content:
Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Ketamine and drug tests & urine screens.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing

It is possible to test for the presence of ketamine metabolites in urine, blood, & hair, but it is an uncommon test to do. In the last couple years ketamine has become more widely known in the popular media and some testing companies have added it to their "Club Drug" testing battery. Unless there is a particular reason to be looking for it, as in the case of an autopsy, specific ketamine tests are not normally conducted. It is not one of the SAMHSA-5 standardly tested for in the basic drug test, nor is it included in the extended drug tests. If testing for ketamine is specifically requested, according to Ketamine: Dreams and Realities, norketamine, the breakdown product of ketamine, is detectable in both blood and urine for 7-14 days and possibly longer in heavy users. As of 2013, extended panel lab tests are now including ketamine in some areas.

FALSE POSITIVES #

Substances or Conditions which can cause false positives


                    Context: 
                    This section provides detailed information on the types of drug tests used to detect ketamine, the rarity of such tests, the detection window in bodily fluids, and recent developments in testing practices. It follows the summary of standard and extended drug test inclusion and precedes discussion of substances or conditions causing false positives for ketamine.

metadata.title: Erowid Ketamine Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about Ketamine and drug tests & urine screens.

content:
Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about Ketamine and drug tests & urine screens.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    FALSE POSITIVES #

Substances or Conditions which can cause false positives

Ketamine may cause false positives for PCP on some drug screens (1), but is clearly differentiable using follow-up confirming tests such as GC/MS. This is of less interest now that Ketamine itself is also illegal.

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's drug testing information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, journal articles, websites, and other resources. Detection periods depend on amount and frequency of use, metabolic rate, body mass, age, overall health, drug tolerance, and urine pH of each individual. Many substances that are not tested for in basic or extended urinalysis tests CAN be tested for by a laboratory willing to go to the trouble, although that is uncommon.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #

Drug Testing Vault

Compare Ketamine & PCP's Chemical Structures

OFF-SITE RESOURCES #


                    Context: 
                    This section discusses the possibility of ketamine causing false positives for PCP on drug tests, details differentiation methods like GC/MS, and provides a disclaimer about the variability and limitations of drug testing. It appears after describing ketamine drug detection methods and before listing related resources and links.

NOTES #

Recent ketamine administration can produce a urine toxic screen which is falsely positive for phencyclidine. Shannon M Pediatric Emerg Care 1998 Apr;14(2):180
